paper_metadata.title: SPIR (Strengthen PSNP Institutions and Resilience) Graduation Program Evaluation

program_information.target_population: PSNP beneficiaries (poorest 20% of rural Ethiopian households)

component_a_cash_support.cash_evidence_citation: The core set of interventions includes $200 lump sum transfer for the poorest households

component_b_assets.assets_evidence_citation: The primary livelihoods intervention package is a $200 transfer (randomly assigned to be cash or poultry) in conjunction with training and establishment of savings groups

study_characteristics.outcomes_evidence_citation: Outcomes of interest [...] Assets Total asset value; value of productive assets, consumer durables, livestock assets [...] Credit and savings [...] Income from livestock sales [...] Consumption and food security Consumption expenditure (total, food, nonfood); food insecurity experience scale
study_characteristics.design_evidence_citation: We evaluate the effects of SPIR in a large randomized controlled trial

evidence_citations.program_name_citation: SPIR (Strengthen PSNP Institutions and Resilience) â€¢ In this talk, I will present new evidence from a randomized trial of a lighter-touch graduation model implemented at scale in rural Ethiopia, during the first phase of SPIR
evidence_citations.country_citation: implemented at scale in rural Ethiopia [...] in 192 kebeles in 13 woredas in two regions, Amhara and Oromia
evidence_citations.target_population_citation: SPIR targets households who are beneficiaries of the Productive Safety Net Program (PSNP), and thus are among the poorest 20% of rural Ethiopian households
